data-definition.struct-type: -- If shot by a ranged weapon:

enum-item.name: wanderer
enum-item.comment: wandering the wilds/region/depths of the world (none/region/underground_region)

enum-item.name: refugee
enum-item.comment: into region only for dead. refugees and abucted-imprisoned-turned

enum-item.name: army_died
enum-item.comment: either no record of participation in battle, or character died and defender won (character on either side)

enum-item.name: army_survived
enum-item.comment: either no record of participation in battle, or character survived and defender won (character on either side)

enum-item.name: visitor
enum-item.comment: 'visited' as last movement seems to be the key

enum-item.name: no_statement
enum-item.comment: alive or dead, but death conditions not registered here

enum-item.name: region_battle
enum-item.comment: parameters: two unknown values, usually small, with same pair being the same region, but neither is region_id

enum-item.name: entombed
enum-item.comment: same parameters as for site_battle, but structure seems to always be present and be a tomb

enum-item.name: site
enum-item.comment: same parameters as for site_battle, old age and deadly confrontation seen

enum-item.name: Indirect_Director
enum-item.comment: Seen as 'possibly unknown director' in actor's exported XML when influencing the plotter using an intermediary in Legends Mode

enum-item.name: Director
enum-item.comment: Seen with no role or 'potential employer' in actor's exported XML, and as the one influencing the plotter in Legends Mode

struct-type.pointer: only a guess since most of figures have 102 (STANDARD); some have stuff like CLERK, SCOUT, BEAST_HUNTER, etc

stl-vector.name: events2
stl-vector.comment: ones that were stolen or destroyed?

int32_t.comment: this value and the next one seem to always have the same values for the same site. Cannot find any match for them, though

int32_t.name: year
int32_t.comment: time of arrival at site/region_id, not time of death

stl-vector.name: known_secrets
stl-vector.comment: Interactions inflicted upon the figure through an I_SOURCE:SECRET means are recorded here; this appears to prevent the interaction from affecting the figure again on subsequent exposure (when rereading a necromancy slab, for example). For interactions with both I_SOURCE:SECRET and another source (I_SOURCE:INGESTION, for example), exposure to the interaction through the non-secret route does not result in the interaction being listed here.

stl-vector.name: known_written_contents
stl-vector.comment: ID of written_contents known to the historical figure. Aside from the contents of read books, these so-called written contents also include known derivations of poetic forms, dance forms and musical forms

stl-vector.name: known_identities
stl-vector.comment: identity ID of identities known to the historical figure, such as demon true names
same length as next vector. Might be entities

uint32_t.name: research_points
uint32_t.comment: research is finished at 100k? amount gained depends on skills, attributes

uint16_t.name: times_pondered
uint16_t.comment: one per ponder no matter what. turns into research_points somewhere around 40-60.

pointer.name: belief_systems
pointer.comment: found in prophets; contains the ID of the belief system developed by that particular prophet

int32_t.name: original_histfig_id
int32_t.comment: ID of the historical figure who was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

int32_t.name: original_race
int32_t.comment: race of the historical figure who was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

int32_t.name: original_caste
int32_t.comment: caste of the historical figure who was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

int32_t.name: root_body_part_id
int32_t.comment: ID of the root body part in the corpse or corpse piece which was reanimated to produce undead historical figure

stl-string.name: undead_name
stl-string.comment: display name of reanimated creatures in legends mode

stl-vector.name: races
stl-vector.comment: contains IDs of races created by the historical figure through experimentation

pointer.name: books
pointer.comment: seems to be misnamed. Artifacts seen have been of all kinds

stl-vector.name: artifacts_held
stl-vector.comment: held as in possession, doesn't include stored

static-array.comment: wildly varying contents. Probably unitialized, as at least some change when same save reloaded

pointer.compound: there's an unused dword here on 64-bit

stl-vector.name: unk1
stl-vector.comment: all 4 vectors same length and only 0 and 1 seen. Only values 78-80 seen

int32_t.name: id
int32_t.comment: starts as index in parent vector

stl-vector.name: unk5_t14_1
stl-vector.comment: seems like sorted sequence of double digit numbers

int32_t.name: action
int32_t.comment: 8:prepare coup, 9:steal treasures and prepare coup. Bitmap?

int32_t.name: id
int32_t.comment: index into the parent vector (at least initially)

int32_t.name: unk9_6
int32_t.comment: site government seen. Target? Possible threat?

int32_t.name: unk9_10
int32_t.comment: site government seen. Target? Member of/possible threat?

stl-vector.name: unk11
stl-vector.comment: 4 bytes allocated observed, which cant' host a pointer

int32_t.name: family_head_id
int32_t.comment: When a unit is asked about their family in adventure mode, the historical figure corresponding to this ID is called the head of the family or ancestor.

pointer.name: vague_relationships
pointer.comment: Do hot have to be available mutually, i.e. DF can display Legends relations forming for the other party that does not have an entry (plus time and other conditions not located)

enum-type.comment: Some of these require at least one parameter of varying type. The text is what DF provides without parameter

item-attr.name: caption
item-attr.value: for an insurrection

item-attr.name: caption
item-attr.value: to adventure

item-attr.name: caption
item-attr.value: as a guide

enum-item.name: hidden
enum-item.comment: event is hidden from legends mode when this is set

class-type.virtual-methods:
-- 10

"In x, some event happened"
"the happening of some event"
-- 30

bool.name: a_support_merc_enid_toggle
bool.comment: Toggles attacker_merc_enid field into a_support_merc_enid. Not seen defender_merc_enid set together with this flag

enum-item.name: QUIT
enum-item.comment: Give in to starvation as adventurer

int32_t.name: creator_unit_id
int32_t.comment: the unit who created the artifact

int32_t.name: creator_hfid
int32_t.comment: the figure who created the artifact
probably feature_layer_id, based on other events, but haven't seen non -1
probably subregion_id, based on other events, but haven't seen non -1
probably feature_layer_id, based on other events, but haven't seen non -1

bool.name: a_support_merc_enid_toggle
bool.comment: Toggles attacker_merc_enid field into a_support_merc_enid. Not seen defender_merc_enid set together with this flag

flag-bit.name: bled_dry
flag-bit.comment: tribute was demanded, but not received

int32_t.name: building
int32_t.comment: Guess. the values seen are low numbers. Legends doesn't provide any additional info

int32_t.name: reason_id
int32_t.comment: the historical figure that the reason describes

int32_t.name: entity
int32_t.comment: the guild to which the figure belongs?

int16_t.name: topic
int16_t.comment: 11 = set entity 1 against entity 2, 12 = entity 1 should love entity 2

data-definition.class-type: ? 6 = plots and schemes, 11 = agent ? 4 = plots and schemes, 21 = agent

flag-bit.name: no_prison_available
flag-bit.comment: would have been imprisoned but for lack of accommodations

flag-bit.name: plot_surveillance
flag-bit.comment: due to ongoing surveillance as the plot unfolded

flag-bit.name: target_surveillance
flag-bit.comment: due to ongoing surveillance on the target

flag-bit.name: co_conspirator_surveillance
flag-bit.comment: due to ongoing surveillance on a coconspirator

data-definition.class-type: these new fields are probably mixed in above or below
most likely the same format as above

int32_t.name: percent
int32_t.comment: either percentage of single race or percentage of mundane

data-definition.struct-type:
dtor 8532fa0
some value during worldgen, and at the end equals to the number of entities plus that value
unsure but 16-bit values make more sense than 32-bit
11 - necromancers
